name.text: 14.3.1.1 Volumes generated by rotating curves about the x-axis

questiontext.text:
Volumes generated by rotating curves about the x-axis

The figure below shows a graph of the function \(y=2x\) for \(x\) between 0 and 3.


Imagine rotating the line \(y=2x\) by one complete revolution (\(360^{\circ}\) or \(2\pi\) radians) around the \(x\)-axis. The surface so formed is the surface of a cone as shown in the figure below. Such a three-dimensional shape is known as a solid of revolution. We now discuss how to obtain the volumes of such solids of revolution.
